c74object.name: fl.crest~
c74object.digest: Calculates the crest factor of the input frame
c74object.description: The output is a single value. When the input frame is empty then the output is determined by the empty parameter.

entry.name: /empty [instantiation enum]
entry.description:
Sets the output to use when an empty input frame is received:
empty - output an empty frame.
default - output the default value (see the default parameter).
[0] - empty [1] - default

objarg.name: empty
objarg.digest: Sets the output to use when an empty input frame is received
objarg.description:
This argument sets the empty parameter:
Sets the output to use when an empty input frame is received:
empty - output an empty frame.
default - output the default value (see the default parameter).

objarg.name: default
objarg.description:
This argument sets the default parameter:
Sets the default output value.

method.name: info
method.description:
Print info about fl.crest~ to the max window for reference purposes. If no arguments are provided then all information is posted to the Max window. Else, a set of flags is used to select which sections of the reference to display, and whether or not the information should be provided in a shortened form.
The following flags are available:
description - display the object description.inputs - display info on inputs.outputs - display info on outputs.io - display info on both inputs and outputs.parameters - display info on the object parameters.quick - display shorten versions of any info displayed.

method.name: frame
method.description: Used internally by FrameLib's connection routines. User messages have no effect.

method.name: sync
method.description: Used internally by FrameLib's connection routines. User messages have no effect.

attribute.name: rt
attribute.description:
Sets the realtime state for fl.crest~. When set to 0 fl.crest~ can form part of a non-realtime network for processing in message threads, using buffer~ objects for audio IO.
More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description:
Sets the context name for fl.crest~.
More info on FrameLib contexts can be found in Tutorial 10.
